Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,538Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 13

Summary: The thing was, if Merlin had ever really thought about it, he wouldn’t have imagined Arthur had any particular opinions about how one should celebrate Christmas.  His father wasn’t fond of Christmas and ignored its existence as much as possible, and Arthur had never accepted any of his friends’ invitations to join their family’s holiday celebrations or even Gwaine, Lancelot, and Percy’s relaxed, no family Christmas that seemed to involve a lot of drinking and watching of football matches, which was right up Arthur's alley.  Arthur, as far Merlin could tell, had no childhood nostalgia for the holiday and so had no particular interest in it at all as an adult. But this year, Merlin and Arthur were a couple, and since Merlin’s mother was coming to visit Merlin for the holidays instead of him going back Ealdor like usual, Arthur had agreed to join them for Christmas.  And suddenly, Arthur had a lot of opinions about Christmas.  A truly overwhelming amount of opinions, in fact. Arthur gets a little intense about Christmas and Merlin finds it both confusing and adorable. A follow-up to Bake Me a Cake, but not necessary to read that fic to understand this one.
